oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Charlie Daniels - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Charlie Daniels (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of December 05, 1988. The episode is part 2 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Charlie Daniels
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Charlie Daniels Pulsebeat show -- (00:50) Boogie Woogie Country Blues (Charlie Daniels) -- (03:56) Spangler introduces the break -- (04:10) Spangler and Daniels discuss the country roots of "Homesick Heroes" -- (04:45) Spangler introduces Daniels to recall how he treats negative reviews -- (06:03) The mistaken nature of "The South's Gonna do it Again" is discussed, and Spangler and Daniels discuss what in the South inspires artists -- (08:51) The South's Gonna do it Again (Charlie Daniels) -- (12:42) Dial 901 [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (13:40) Danny Thomas performs a St. Jude's commercial spot -- (14:20) Spangler asks Daniels to make a song request -- (15:48) Statesboro Blues (Allman Brothers Band) -- (19:59) Spangler asks Daniels is he is tired of "The Devil Went Down to Georgia" -- (21:10) The Devil Went Down to Georgia (Charlie Daniels) --(24:28) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Daniels, Charlie; Daniels, Charlie, 1936-;
